newsitem.title: CANADA: British Columbia 1995/96 deficit C$369 million.
newsitem.headline: British Columbia 1995/96 deficit C$369 million.

text.p: Final figures for British Columbia's 1995/96 fiscal year will show a deficit of C$369 million, provincial Finance Minister Andrew Petter said on Wednesday.

The government previously put the deficit for the year ended March 31, 1996 at C$235 million. Speaking to reporters before a cabinet meeting, Petter attributed the larger deficit to a shortfall in transfers from the federal government and lower than expected tax and fee revenues.
The final accounts are due to be published later this month. The government has been under attack for failing to meet its previous forecasts of a budget surplus.
